docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists have proposed a novel hypothesis to explain how a pregnant woman develops a serious condition called pre-eclampsia.

headline.seo: Study Finds Clues to Sneaky Protein Linked to Pre-eclampsia
headline.main: Turncoat of Placenta Is Watched for Trouble
headline.print_headline: Turncoat Of Placenta Is Watched For Trouble

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Reproductive Sciences suggests PP13 protein may play key role in development of pre-eclampsia, form of high blood pressure in pregnancy that strains mother's kidneys;.
docs.snippet: Scientists have proposed a novel hypothesis to explain how a pregnant woman develops a serious condition called pre-eclampsia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Supplemental calcium does not prevent preterm birth or improve bone density in pregnant women, according to a new report.

headline.seo: Pregnant Women’s Gains From Extra Calcium May Be Limited
headline.main: Childbirth: Limited Gains From Supplemental Calcium
headline.print_headline: Childbirth: Limited Gains From Supplemental Calcium

docs.abstract: Analysis published in the Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews finds supplemental calcium does not prevent preterm birth or improve bone density in pregnant women.
docs.snippet: Supplemental calcium does not prevent preterm birth or improve bone density in pregnant women, according to a new report.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new test may reduce the need for riskier invasive procedures like amniocentesis, but it raises ethical issues.

headline.seo: Sequenom’s Test for Down Syndrome Raises Hopes and Questions
headline.main: A Less Risky Down Syndrome Test Is Developed
headline.print_headline: A Less Risky Down Test Lifts Hopes

docs.abstract: New test to detect Down syndrome in a fetus using a sample of the mother's blood may reduce the need for riskier invasive procedures like amniocentesis; researchers say tests may not be reliable enough yet to replace traditional testing, but may reduce the need for such procedures; there is some concern that test could lead more women to end pregnancies, causing a decline in the number of people with the condition and leading to diminished support for them.
docs.snippet: The new test may reduce the need for riskier invasive procedures like amniocentesis, but it raises ethical issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE FACTS For many people, yoga is more than just exercise: Studies show it is one of the most commonly used forms of alternative therapy in the country. Many rely on yoga to relieve chronic and acute pain.

headline.main: The Claim: Yoga can help manage pain.

docs.snippet: THE FACTS     For many people, yoga is more than just exercise: Studies show it is one of the most commonly used forms of alternative therapy in the country. Many rely on yoga to relieve chronic and acute pain.

docs.abstract: A new study debunks the benefits of segregation by sex in the classroom, and says the practice does more harm than good. Should it be illegal?
docs.snippet: A new study debunks the benefits of segregation by sex in the classroom, and says the practice does more harm than good. Should it be illegal?

headline.main: Really? The Claim: Yoga Can Help Manage Pain
headline.print_headline: The Claim: Yoga can help manage pain.

docs.abstract: Plenty of studies have tried to determine whether taking up yoga can help lessen pain.
docs.snippet: Plenty of studies have tried to determine whether taking up yoga can help lessen pain.

docs.abstract: Plenty of studies have tried to determine whether taking up yoga can help lessen pain.

docs.lead_paragraph: Huge budget cuts in Texas to family planning have forced Planned Parenthood and other clinics to lay off staff and shut down some locations.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Struggles After State Budget Cuts
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Struggles After State Budget Cuts

docs.lead_paragraph: From 1981 through 1994, Mitt Romney operated as clergyman, organization man and defender of the Mormon faith.

headline.main: For Romney, a Role of Faith and Authority
headline.print_headline: For Romney, a Role of Faith and Authority

docs.abstract: Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney operated as clergyman, organizer and defender of the Mormon faith from 1981 through 1994, guiding the church in Boston through a tumultuous period of rapid growth; facing a primary electorate in which Christian conservatives are a powerful force, Romney is trying to keep his religion from becoming a barrier to his election. (Series: The Long Run)
docs.snippet: From 1981 through 1994, Mitt Romney operated as clergyman, organization man and defender of the Mormon faith.

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: How do you parent without a future, knowing that you will lose your child, bit by bit?
docs.abstract: Emily Rapp Op-Ed article describes the challenges of being a parent to her infant son, who will slowly die before the age of three due to the fact that he was born with Tay-Sachs, a rare genetic disorder.
docs.snippet: How do you parent without a future, knowing that you will lose your child, bit by bit?
